messages.content:
આધાર પર, તમારા પ્લોટ માટે ગણતરી કરેલ સિંચાઈના કલાકો 1.91 કલાક છે.

હું આ ગણતરી માટે નીચેના સેટિંગ્સનો ઉપયોગ કર્યો:
- રુટ પહોળાઈ: 24 ઇંચ
- રુટ ઊંડાઈ: 12 ઇંચ
- મીઠા ધરતીની જાળવણી: 150 મીમી
- ડ્રિપર અંતર: 1.3 મીમી
- ડ્રિપર ડિસ્ચાર્જ: 2 લિટર

શું તમે અલગ સેટિંગ્સ સાથે સિંચાઈના કલાકો ગણવા માંગો છો? જો હા, તો કૃપા કરીને નવા મૂલ્યો આપો.

faq:
Q: What are mixed fertilizers (NPK)?
A: NPK fertilizers are represented by a three-number sequence, such as 10-10-10, indicating the percentage by weight of each nutrient. For example, 10-10-10 means the fertilizer contains 10% Nitrogen, 10% Phosphorus, and 10% Potassium elements in the chemical mixture. Some examples are below:
0-40-37, 0-40-40, 0-49-32, 0-52-34 (Mono potassium phosphate), 0-55-18, 0-60-20, 0-9-46, 10-26-26, 10-54-10, 11-44-11, 12-11-18, 12-32-16, 12-61-0, 13-0-45 (Potassium Nitrate), 13-40-13, 19-19-19, 20-20-0-13 (Ammonium Phosphate Sulphate), 24-24-0, 30-10-10, 6-34-17
Or 0:40:37, 0:40:40, 0:49:32, 0:52:34 (Mono potassium phosphate), 0:55:18, 0:60:20, 0:9:46, 10:26:26, 10:54:10, 11:44:11, 12:11:18, 12:32:16, 12:61:0, 13:0:45 (Potassium Nitrate), 13:40:13, 19:19:19, 20:20:0:13 (Ammonium Phosphate Sulphate), 24:24:0, 30:10:10, 6:34:17
Or 0.40.37, 0.40.40, 0.49.32, 0.52.34 (Mono potassium phosphate), 0.55.18, 0.60.20, 0.9.46, 10.26.26, 10.54.10, 11.44.11, 12.11.18, 12.32.16, 12.61.0, 13.0.45 (Potassium Nitrate), 13.40.13, 19.19.19, 20.20.0.13 (Ammonium Phosphate Sulphate), 24.24.0, 30.10.10, 6.34.17

messages.content:
આપના પ્લોટ માટે ખાતરનો વર્તમાન અને આગામી ફર્ટિગેશન શેડ્યૂલ નીચે આપેલ છે:

### Om Farm (પ્લોટ 1)
- **વર્તમાન તબક્કો:** મધ્ય તબક્કાનો ફળ વિકાસ (1મો સપ્તાહ)
  - **ફોલિયર પદ્ધતિ:** 
    - **ખાતર:** મોનો પોટેશિયમ ફોસ્ફેટ
    - **માત્રા:** 3 કિલોગ્રામ/એકર
    - **નોટ:** ફોલિયર સ્પ્રેમાં માઇક્રો-ન્યુટ્રિયન્ટ ખાતરનો સંકેત 1% થી વધુ ન હોવો જોઈએ (ઉદાહરણ: 5 કિલોગ્રામ 500 લિટર પાણીમાં).
  
  - **ફર્ટિગેશન પદ્ધતિ:**
    - **વિકલ્પ 1:** 
      - પોટેશિયમ નાઇટ્રેટ: 4 કિલોગ્રામ/એકર
      - યુરિયા: 1 કિલોગ્રામ/એકર
    - **વિકલ્પ 2:**
      - યુરિયા: 2 કિલોગ્રામ/એકર
      - સલ્ફેટ ઓફ પોટાશ: 3.5 કિલોગ્રામ/એકર

- **આગામી તબક્કો:** મોડા તબક્કાનો ફળ વિકાસ અને કાપ

### Rudra Farm (પ્લોટ 2)
- **વર્તમાન તબક્કો:** મધ્ય તબક્કાનો ફળ વિકાસ (1મો સપ્તાહ)
  - **ફોલિયર પદ્ધતિ:** 
    - **ખાતર:** મોનો પોટેશિયમ ફોસ્ફેટ
    - **માત્રા:** 3 કિલોગ્રામ/એકર
    - **નોટ:** ફોલિયર સ્પ્રેમાં માઇક્રો-ન્યુટ્રિયન્ટ ખાતરનો સંકેત 1% થી વધુ ન હોવો જોઈએ (ઉદાહરણ: 5 કિલોગ્રામ 500 લિટર પાણીમાં).
  
  - **ફર્ટિગેશન પદ્ધતિ:**
    - **વિકલ્પ 1:** 
      - પોટેશિયમ નાઇટ્રેટ: 4 કિલોગ્રામ/એકર
      - યુરિયા: 1 કિલોગ્રામ/એકર
    - **વિકલ્પ 2:**
      - યુરિયા: 2 કિલોગ્રામ/એકર
      - સલ્ફેટ ઓફ પોટાશ: 3.5 કિલોગ્રામ/એકર

- **આગામી તબક્કો:** મોડા તબક્કાનો ફળ વિકાસ અને કાપ

જો તમને વધુ માહિતીની જરૂર હોય, તો કૃપા કરીને જણાવો!
messages.en:
The current and upcoming fertigation schedule of fertilizer for your plot is given below:

### Om Farm (Plot 1)
* **Current phase:** Mid-stage fruit development (1st week)
  - **Foliar method:** 
    - **Fertilizer:** Mono potassium phosphate
    * **Quantity:** 3 kg/acre
    * *Note:** The indication of micro-nutrient fertilizer in foliar spray should not be more than 1% (e.g.: 5 kg in 500 liters of water).
  
* **Fertigation method:**
    - **Option 1:** 
      Potassium nitrate: 4 kg/acre
      Urea: 1 kg/acre
    - **Option 2:**
      Urea: 2 kg/acre
      Sulphate of Potash: 3.5 kg/acre

* **Next stage:** Late stage fruit growth and harvest

### Rudra Farm (Plot 2)
* **Current phase:** Mid-stage fruit development (1st week)
  - **Foliar method:** 
    - **Fertilizer:** Mono potassium phosphate
    * **Quantity:** 3 kg/acre
    * *Note:** The indication of micro-nutrient fertilizer in foliar spray should not be more than 1% (e.g.: 5 kg in 500 liters of water).
  
* **Fertigation method:**
    - **Option 1:** 
      Potassium nitrate: 4 kg/acre
      Urea: 1 kg/acre
    - **Option 2:**
      Urea: 2 kg/acre
      Sulphate of Potash: 3.5 kg/acre

* **Next stage:** Late stage fruit growth and harvest

If you need more information, please let me know!

messages.content:
તમે અપલોડ કરેલ છબીમાં દાડમના ફળો પર રંગ બદલાવ અને સપાટી પર સમસ્યાઓ દેખાઈ રહી છે, જે રોગ અથવા પેસ્ટની સંકેત આપી શકે છે. પરંતુ, હાલના દોરમાં ચોક્કસ દવા માટેની ભલામણ મળી નથી.

કૃપા કરીને વધુ સ્પષ્ટ છબી આપો, જેમાં અસરગ્રસ્ત વિસ્તારો પર ધ્યાન કેન્દ્રિત કરવામાં આવે, સારી પ્રકાશ અને ફોકસ સાથે. આથી, ચોક્કસ સમસ્યાઓની ઓળખ કરવામાં વધુ સહાય મળશે.

messages.content:
છબીમાં દેખાતા કાળા ટપકાઓ દાડમના ફળોમાં રોગના સંકેત હોઈ શકે છે. અહીં કેટલીક સામાન્ય વ્યવસ્થાઓ છે:

1. **અસરગ્રસ્ત ફળો દૂર કરો**: રોગના લક્ષણો દર્શાવતા ફળોને દૂર કરો અને નાશ કરો, જેથી વધુ ફેલાવા અટકાય.
2. **હવા પ્રવાહ સુધારો**: છોડ વચ્ચે યોગ્ય અંતર રાખીને હવા પ્રવાહ વધારવા માટે ખાતરી કરો.
3. **ફંગિસાઇડનો ઉપયોગ**: જો સમસ્યા ચાલુ રહે, તો સ્થાનિક કૃષિ માર્ગદર્શિકાઓને અનુસરીને વ્યાપક ફંગિસાઇડનો ઉપયોગ કરવા પર વિચાર કરો.

વધુ ચોક્કસ સલાહ માટે, કૃપા કરીને સ્થાનિક કૃષિ નિષ્ણાત અથવા વિસ્તરણ સેવા સાથે સંપર્ક કરો. જો તમારી પાસે વધુ છબીઓ અથવા પાકની સ્થિતિ વિશે વિગતો હોય, તો શેર કરવા માટે સ્વતંત્ર રહો!
messages.en:
The black dots seen in the image may be a sign of disease in pomegranate fruits. Here are some common arrangements:

1. **Remove affected fruits**: Remove and destroy fruits showing symptoms of the disease, so as to prevent further spread.
2. **Improve air flow**: Make sure to increase the air flow by keeping a proper distance between the plants.
3. Use of **Fungicide**: If the problem persists, consider using a wide range of fungisides following local agricultural guidelines.

For more specific advice, please contact a local agriculture expert or extension service. If you have more images or details about crop conditions, be free to share!

આ રોગના નિયંત્રણ માટે સામાન્ય રીતે નીચેના પગલાં લઈ શકાય છે:

1. **સફાઈ**: પ્લોટમાંથી તમામ મરેલા પાંદડા અને કચરો દૂર કરો.
2. **જળવાયુ નિયંત્રણ**: જમીનને વધુ ભેજમાં રાખવા માટે યોગ્ય જળવાયુ વ્યવસ્થા કરો.
3. **પેસ્ટિસાઇડ્સ**: યોગ્ય પેસ્ટિસાઇડ્સનો ઉપયોગ કરો, જે ખાસ કરીને આ રોગ માટે અસરકારક હોય.
4. **પ્લોટની દેખરેખ**: નિયમિત રીતે પ્લોટની દેખરેખ રાખો અને રોગના લક્ષણો જોતા જ તરત જ પગલાં લો.

જો તમને વધુ માહિતી અથવા સહાયની જરૂર હોય, તો કૃપા કરીને જણાવો.

messages.content: Citrus nematode k lakshan
messages.en: Citrus nematode k lakshan
messages.standalone_question: What are the characteristics of Citrus nematode?
messages.standalone_en: What are the characteristics of Citrus nematode?

messages.content:
Citrus nematode (Tylenchulus semipenetrans) is a significant pest affecting citrus crops. Here are the symptoms (lakshan) associated with citrus nematode infestation:

1. **Root Damage**: The nematodes invade the roots, causing galls or lesions, which can lead to root decay.
2. **Stunted Growth**: Infected plants often exhibit stunted growth and reduced vigor.
3. **Yellowing Leaves**: Leaves may turn yellow, especially older leaves, indicating nutrient deficiencies.
4. **Poor Fruit Development**: The quality and quantity of fruit may decline, with smaller and fewer fruits produced.
5. **Wilting**: Plants may show signs of wilting, particularly during dry conditions, due to impaired root function.
6. **Reduced Yield**: Overall yield is significantly reduced in heavily infested plants.

Control measures include soil fumigation, crop rotation, and planting resistant varieties if available. Regular monitoring and maintaining healthy soil conditions can also help manage nematode populations.
messages.en:

4. **Poor Fruit Development**: The quality and quantity of fruit may decline, with smaller and fewer fruits produced.

6. **Reduced Yield**: Overall yield is significantly reduced in heavily infested plants.

Control measures include soil fumigation, crop rotation, and planting resistant varieties if available. Regular monitoring and maintaining healthy soil conditions can also help manage nematode populations.

messages.content: Kya treatment kre?
messages.en: Kya treatment kre?
messages.standalone_question: What treatment options are available for citrus nematode infestation?
messages.standalone_en: What treatment options are available for citrus nematode infestation?

messages.content:
For effective treatment during the seedling stage, you can follow these recommendations:

### Pest Control:
1. **Pests**: Ants, Termites, Root Aphids, Thrips, Internal Borers
   - **Insecticide Treatment**: Drench or spray seedlings with:
     - **Chlorpyriphos**: 5 mL/Liter of water
     - **Thiamethoxam**: 0.5 g/Liter of water

### Seed Treatment:
1. **Insecticide**: 
   - **Imidacloprid 600 FS**: 5 to 8 mL/kg of seeds
2. **Fungicide**: 
   - **Thiram**: 2 to 3 g/kg of seeds

### Disease Control:
1. **Diseases**: Collar Rot, Damping Off, Seedling Blight
   - **Fungicide Treatment**: Drench or spray seedlings with:
     - **Carbendazim**: 2.5 g/Liter of water

### Benefits of Treatment:
- Prevents the spread of diseases and pests.
- Protects seeds from rot and blight.
- Improves germination rates.
- Provides protection from storage insects and soil insects.

Make sure to follow the recommended dosages and application methods for the best results.

messages.content: Nematode ka treatment
messages.en: Nematode ka treatment
messages.standalone_question: What are the treatment options for nematodes?
messages.standalone_en: What are the treatment options for nematodes?

messages.content:
Citrus nematode treatment involves several strategies to manage and control the infestation. Here are some effective methods:

### 1. **Cultural Practices:**
   - **Crop Rotation**: Rotate citrus with non-host crops to break the nematode life cycle.
   - **Soil Management**: Improve soil health through organic matter addition and proper drainage.

### 2. **Chemical Control:**
   - **Soil Fumigation**: Use nematicides like **1,3-Dichloropropene** or **Methyl Bromide** before planting to reduce nematode populations.
   - **Nematicides**: Apply nematicides such as **Oxamyl** or **Carbofuran** according to label instructions.

### 3. **Biological Control:**
   - **Beneficial Nematodes**: Introduce beneficial nematodes that prey on citrus nematodes.
   - **Microbial Products**: Use products containing beneficial bacteria or fungi that can suppress nematode populations.

### 4. **Resistant Varieties:**
   - Plant citrus varieties that are resistant to nematodes if available.

### 5. **Regular Monitoring:**
   - Regularly check for nematode presence and root health to take timely action.

### 6. **Soil Solarization:**
   - Cover the soil with clear plastic for several weeks during hot weather to heat the soil and kill nematodes.

Implementing a combination of these methods will help effectively manage citrus nematodes and protect your crops.
messages.en:
Citrus nematode treatment involves several strategies to manage and control the infestation. Here are some effective methods:

### 1. **Cultural Practices:**
   - **Crop Rotation**: Rotate citrus with non-host crops to break the nematode life cycle.
   - **Soil Management**: Improve soil health through organic matter addition and proper drainage.

### 2. **Chemical Control:**
   - **Soil Fumigation**: Use nematicides like **1,3-Dichloropropene** or **Methyl Bromide** before planting to reduce nematode populations.
   - **Nematicides**: Apply nematicides such as **Oxamyl** or **Carbofuran** according to label instructions.

### 3. **Biological Control:**
   - **Beneficial Nematodes**: Introduce beneficial nematodes that prey on citrus nematodes.
   - **Microbial Products**: Use products containing beneficial bacteria or fungi that can suppress nematode populations.

### 4. **Resistant Varieties:**
   - Plant citrus varieties that are resistant to nematodes if available.

### 5. **Regular Monitoring:**
   - Regularly check for nematode presence and root health to take timely action.

### 6. **Soil Solarization:**
   - Cover the soil with clear plastic for several weeks during hot weather to heat the soil and kill nematodes.

Implementing a combination of these methods will help effectively manage citrus nematodes and protect your crops.

messages.content: Hexaconazole
messages.en: Hexaconazole
messages.standalone_question: What is Hexaconazole?
messages.standalone_en: What is Hexaconazole?

messages.content:
Hexaconazole is a systemic fungicide used to control various fungal diseases in crops. It is effective against diseases like leaf spot, powdery mildew, and rust. For tea crops, it can be used to manage fungal infections effectively.

The recommended dosage for Hexaconazole is typically around 0.1% to 0.2% concentration in water for foliar application. Always follow the manufacturer's instructions for specific application rates and timing based on the disease pressure and crop stage.

messages.content: Nativo fungicide is harmfull for honeybee?
messages.standalone_question: Is Nativo fungicide harmful to honeybees?
messages.standalone_en: Is Nativo fungicide harmful to honeybees?

messages.content: Yes, Nativo fungicide can be harmful to honeybees. It contains active ingredients that may pose risks to pollinators, including honeybees, especially if applied during flowering when bees are active. It's important to follow label instructions and consider alternative pest management strategies to protect beneficial insects.

messages.content:
પ્લોટ 2માં થિપ્સ (Thrips)ના સંકેત જોવા મળ્યા છે. આ જીવાત પomegranates પર અસર કરે છે અને નીચેના લક્ષણો દર્શાવે છે:

- પાનના ઉપરના ભાગે નાના ચાંદીના ધબ્બા.
- પાનનો પીળો પડવો.
- પાન, ફૂલો અને ફળોમાં વિકાર.

થિપ્સને નિયંત્રિત કરવા માટે, તમે નીચેની દવાઓનો ઉપયોગ કરી શકો છો:

1. **Fipronil**
2. **Imidacloprid**
3. **Acetamiprid**

આ દવાઓમાં પાઇપેરોનિલ બ્યુટોક્સાઇડનો સમાવેશ થાય છે, જે અસરકારકતા વધારવા માટે ઉપયોગી છે. 

યાદ રાખો કે, થિપ્સની ઝડપી પ્રજનન દરને કારણે, વિવિધ પ્રકારની પેસ્ટિસાઇડ્સ સામે તેઓ પ્રતિરોધક બની ગયા છે. તેથી, એકીકૃત દૃષ્ટિકોણ અપનાવવો અને બાયોલોજિકલ ઉપાયો સાથે પ્રિવેન્ટિવ પગલાં લેવું મહત્વપૂર્ણ છે.

1. **Imidacloprid**
2. **Acetamiprid**

યાદ રાખો કે, મીલીબગની નિયંત્રણ માટે એકીકૃત દૃષ્ટિકોણ અપનાવવો મહત્વપૂર્ણ છે, જેમાં બાયોલોજિકલ ઉપાયો અને પ્રિવેન્ટિવ પગલાંનો સમાવેશ થાય છે.

messages.content:
Magnesium sulfate spray ki dose Kinnow ke liye 1-2% solution hoti hai. Iska matlab hai:

- **1-2 kg Magnesium sulfate** ko **100 liters paani** mein milakar spray karein.

Is spray ko behtar results ke liye subah ya shaam ke samay karein, jab dhoop kam ho.
Magnisium sulphate ki kya dose recommend h
messages.standalone_question: What is the recommended dosage of magnesium sulfate?
messages.standalone_en: What is the recommended dosage of magnesium sulfate?

messages.content:
Kinnow ke liye magnesium sulfate (Epsom salt) ki dose aam taur par 20-30 kg per acre hoti hai. Isse aap 2-3 baar mein de sakte hain, jaise ki:

1. Pehli dose: Sowing ke baad.
2. Dusri dose: Flowering ke dauran.
3. Teesri dose: Fruit development ke dauran.

Aap iski dose ko soil test aur crop ki zarurat ke hisaab se adjust kar sakte hain.

messages.standalone_question: What treatment options should I consider?
messages.standalone_en: What treatment options should I consider?

messages.content:
The analysis of your pomegranate image indicates a condition known as "black heart" or "black rot." This can be caused by several factors:

1. **Fungal Infection**: Fungi can cause rot, especially if the fruit is damaged or has been exposed to excessive moisture.
2. **Sunburn**: Intense sunlight exposure without adequate foliage cover can lead to dark patches on the fruit.
3. **Nutritional Deficiencies**: Lack of essential nutrients, particularly potassium, can make the fruit more susceptible to diseases.

### Recommendations:
- **Inspect Other Fruits**: Check other pomegranates on the tree for similar symptoms.
- **Improve Air Circulation**: Ensure proper spacing between plants to reduce humidity and improve airflow.
- **Fungicide Application**: If a fungal infection is suspected, consider applying an appropriate fungicide.
- **Nutrient Management**: Test the soil for nutrient levels and amend as necessary to ensure balanced nutrition.

For a more accurate diagnosis, consider providing a clearer image focusing on the affected area, and include images of the entire plant and surrounding environment if possible.

faq:
Q: Why should I water my crop?
A: Watering your crop is essential to maintain the right moisture balance for healthy growth. Fyllo provides soil monitoring sensors that can provide irrigation precise requirement forecasting. The forecast will also provide the details for why and when you should irrigate.

Q: When should I water? (Hindi: Paani kab dun?)
A: 0-5 kPa is wet, and increasing kPa means increasing dryness. The crop should stay in its optimal moisture zone, and when very close or above the dry optimal moisture, water can be given. Check internal irrigation forecast for the correct answer.

Q: Do I need to spray?
A: Check the disease pest spray schedule for the farmer and reply accordingly. Don't check metrics, only pre-defined schedules to be checked.

Q: which are the insecticide and fungicide to be used for seed treatment
A: Insecticide:  Imidacloprid 600 FS – 5 to 8 ml/kg seeds
Fungicide: Thiram – 2 to 3 gm/kg seed

Q: How much to irrigate after receiving notification?
A: The net quantity of water to be applied depends on the moisture deficit in the soil, leaching requirement, and expectancy of rainfall. When no rainfall is expected and the soil is not saline, the net quantity equals the moisture deficit in the soil.

Q: How do I generate a fertigation schedule in the app?
A: To generate a fertigation schedule, follow these steps:

    1. Go to "My Farm"
    2. Select "Fertigation"
    3. Tap "Create Report"
    4. Fill in all the required details
    5. Save the report
    If you have soil, leaf, or petiole test data, you can input this for a more customized schedule. Otherwise, we can generate a basic schedule using general crop and regional data.

messages.content:
To schedule a spray, follow these steps:

1. **Check the Pest/Disease Prediction**: Look at the current pest or disease predictions for your crops to determine if spraying is necessary.

2. **Review Spray Conditions**: Ensure that the weather conditions are suitable for spraying. Ideal conditions include low wind, no rain, and appropriate temperature and humidity levels.

3. **Select the Right Time**: Choose a time of day when the conditions are optimal, usually early morning or late afternoon.

4. **Prepare the Spray Solution**: Mix the pesticide or fungicide according to the manufacturer's instructions.

5. **Apply the Spray**: Use appropriate equipment to apply the spray evenly across the affected areas.

6. **Record the Activity**: Document the date, time, and type of spray used for future reference.

If you need specific recommendations or schedules based on your plots, let me know!

tools:
get_fertigation_schedule  
Checks the farmer's crop stages and requirements with internal petiole reports and gives the current week fertigation schedule details, and details of the next fertigation schedule (could be next week in the same crop stage or in next crop stage) for the plots. Fertilizers are given by 3 distribution methods:  
- Fertigation: fertilizers put into the irrigation pipeline itself  
- Foliar: on the leaves using a foliar spray  
- Soil: directly on the soil  
If the unit of fertilizer amount includes "per acre", then it is for 1 acre. Otherwise it is for "units per 1 plant".
faq:
Q: Does Fyllo provide a fertigation schedule?
A: Yes, Fyllo provides a fertigation schedule for users.

Q: How can I trust that Fyllo's fertigation schedule is accurate?
A: Fyllo's fertigation schedule is scientifically developed and validated based on crop requirements. It takes into account factors such as crop variety, growth stage, soil conditions, and available nutrient data from soil, leaf, or petiole tests when available.

Q: Where can I find the fertigation schedule in the Fyllo app?
A: To access the fertigation schedule:
    1. Open the Fyllo app
    2. Select "My Farm" at the bottom
    3. Tap on the "Fertigation" option
   You'll find the fertigation schedule there, including details about the required fertilizer applications.

Q: Do I need to do fertigation on my farm?
A: Fyllo provides a fixed fertigation schedule based on plot and crop details, along with weather forecasting data for farmer plots, to decide the fertilizer/fertigation needs.

Q: How does the Fyllo device work?
A: The Fyllo device captures data from 11 sensors at regular intervals. This data is then analyzed using Fyllo's Weather & Agronomical Algorithms to provide alerts to farmers for disease & pest management, irrigation management, fertigation management, and weather prediction.

messages.content:
To schedule a spray in the Fyllo app, follow these steps:

1. **Open the Fyllo App**: Launch the app on your device.

2. **Select "My Farm"**: Navigate to the "My Farm" section at the bottom of the screen.

3. **Access Pest/Disease Information**: Check the pest or disease predictions for your crops to determine if spraying is necessary.

4. **Review Spray Conditions**: Look for the spray condition forecast to find the best times for spraying based on weather conditions.

5. **Schedule the Spray**: Choose an optimal time based on the conditions and your availability. 

6. **Record the Activity**: After spraying, document the date, time, and type of spray used for future reference.

If you need specific spray condition forecasts for your plots, let me know!

messages.content: How delta t is calculated
messages.en: How delta t is calculated
messages.standalone_question: How is delta t calculated?
messages.standalone_en: How is delta t calculated?

messages.content:
Delta T is calculated by finding the difference between the dry bulb temperature and the wet bulb temperature. The formula is:

\[ \text{Delta T} = \text{Dry Bulb Temperature} - \text{Wet Bulb Temperature} \]

- **Dry Bulb Temperature**: This is the air temperature measured by a regular thermometer.
- **Wet Bulb Temperature**: This is the temperature measured by a thermometer that has a wet wick around its bulb, reflecting the cooling effect of evaporation.

Delta T is important for understanding plant transpiration and optimizing conditions for foliar applications.
messages.en:

messages.content:
The image shows leaves with yellowing and dark spots, indicating potential issues:

1. **Fungal Infection**: The dark spots may suggest a fungal disease, like leaf spot disease, often occurring in humid conditions.
2. **Nutrient Deficiency**: Yellowing leaves can indicate a deficiency in essential nutrients, particularly nitrogen or magnesium.
3. **Pest Damage**: The spots might also suggest pest activity, such as aphids or spider mites.

### Recommendations:
- **Inspect for Pests**: Check the undersides of the leaves and surrounding areas for visible pests.
- **Improve Air Circulation**: Ensure good airflow around the plants to reduce humidity and prevent fungal growth.
- **Nutrient Management**: Consider a soil test to check for nutrient deficiencies and apply appropriate fertilizers.
- **Remove Affected Leaves**: Prune any severely affected leaves to prevent the spread of disease.

For a more accurate diagnosis, a clearer image focusing on the affected leaves would be helpful.

faq:
Q: Can fungicide and insecticide be sprayed together?
A: For fungicides and insecticides to be sprayed together, it is important to consider factors like compatibility. For expert guidance tailored to your situation, we recommend reaching out to Fyllo’s CRM number for personalized advice.

Q: which are the insecticide and fungicide to be used for seed treatment
A: Insecticide:  Imidacloprid 600 FS – 5 to 8 ml/kg seeds
Fungicide: Thiram – 2 to 3 gm/kg seed

Q: Do I need to spray?
A: Check the disease pest spray schedule for the farmer and reply accordingly. Don't check metrics, only pre-defined schedules to be checked.

Q: why to use insecticide and fungicide for seed treatment?
A:
- Prevents the spread of plant diseases/pest
- Protects the seed from seed rot and seedling blights
- Improves the seed germination
- Provides protection from storage insects
- Controls the soil insects

Q: How to improve the germination percent
A: Use of good quality seeds and seeds to be treated with insecticide, Fungicide and biological agents

messages.standalone_question: What does "हवेचा दाब" mean?
messages.standalone_en: What does "हवेचा दाब" mean?

messages.content:
हवेचा दाब म्हणजे वायूच्या कणांनी एकत्रितपणे एकत्रित केलेला दाब आहे. हा दाब वातावरणातील वायूच्या कणांच्या गतीमुळे निर्माण होतो. हवेचा दाब विविध घटकांवर अवलंबून असतो, जसे की तापमान, आर्द्रता, आणि समुद्रसपाटीपासूनची उंची. 

कृषी क्षेत्रात, हवेचा दाब महत्त्वाचा आहे कारण तो पिकांच्या वाढीवर आणि रोगांच्या प्रसारावर प्रभाव टाकतो. उच्च हवेचा दाब सामान्यतः चांगल्या हवामानाचे संकेत असतो, तर कमी हवेचा दाब वादळ किंवा खराब हवामानाचे संकेत देऊ शकतो.

messages.content:
थ्रीपसाठी (Thrips) प्रभावी स्प्रे म्हणून खालील पर्याय वापरले जाऊ शकतात:

1. **निम्बा तेल (Neem Oil)**: हे एक नैसर्गिक कीटकनाशक आहे आणि थ्रीपसाठी प्रभावी आहे.
2. **पायरेथ्रिन (Pyrethrin)**: हे एक नैसर्गिक कीटकनाशक आहे जे थ्रीपसवर प्रभावीपणे कार्य करते.
3. **इमिडाक्लोप्रिड (Imidacloprid)**: हे एक सिस्टेमिक कीटकनाशक आहे जे थ्रीपसच्या नियंत्रणासाठी वापरले जाऊ शकते.
4. **स्पिनोसाड (Spinosad)**: हे एक जैविक कीटकनाशक आहे जे थ्रीपसवर प्रभावी आहे.

स्प्रे करण्यापूर्वी, कृपया उत्पादनाच्या लेबलवरील सूचना वाचा आणि योग्य प्रमाणात वापरा. तसेच, पिकांच्या आरोग्यासाठी आणि पर्यावरणासाठी सुरक्षितता सुनिश्चित करण्यासाठी योग्य काळजी घ्या.
फेलपुट काढल्यानंतर कोणते स्प्रे घ्यावे

फेलपुट (Fellput) काढल्यानंतर, पिकांच्या आरोग्यासाठी आणि रोगांच्या नियंत्रणासाठी खालील स्प्रे वापरले जाऊ शकतात:

1. **कॅल्शियम बोरॉन स्प्रे**: हे पिकांच्या वाढीसाठी आणि फळांच्या गुणवत्तेसाठी उपयुक्त आहे.
2. **फफूंदनाशक (Fungicide)**: पिकांमध्ये फफूंद रोगांचा प्रकोप टाळण्यासाठी योग्य फफूंदनाशक वापरा.
3. **निम्बा तेल (Neem Oil)**: हे नैसर्गिक कीटकनाशक आहे आणि पिकांच्या आरोग्यासाठी सुरक्षित आहे.
4. **पायरेथ्रिन (Pyrethrin)**: हे कीटकांच्या नियंत्रणासाठी प्रभावी आहे.

स्प्रे करण्यापूर्वी, उत्पादनाच्या लेबलवरील सूचना वाचा आणि योग्य प्रमाणात वापरा. तसेच, पिकांच्या आरोग्यासाठी आणि पर्यावरणासाठी सुरक्षितता सुनिश्चित करण्यासाठी योग्य काळजी घ्या.

tools:
get_soil_moisture_sensor_depth  
Returns the depths in inches of the soil moisture sensors 1 and 2 installed on the plots.

get_optimal_soil_moistures  
Retrieves the optimal soil moisture values in kPa or percentage above which to irrigate for all plots. 0 kPa means wet, 200 kPa means dry soil. In percentage: 0% means dry, 100% means wet. In percentage values, irrigate when below the optimum range.

live_sensor_data  
Provides the live / most recent sensor data for the plots, last received from the sensors. The data fields could be of these types: airTemperature, airHumidity, soilTemperature, soilMoisture1, soilMoisture2, leafWetness, airPressure, baroPressure, lightIntensity (lux), uvIndex, windSpeed, windDirection, instantaneous rainfall, battery percentage, vaporPressure. Depending on device type, some data may not be available.

get_soil_moisture_percentage_from_kpa_reading  
Gets the estimated soil moisture percentage for a given plot and kPa reading.

Paythopathora k liye kya kre
messages.standalone_question: What should be done for Phytophthora?
messages.standalone_en: What should be done for Phytophthora?

messages.content:
Phytophthora ek fungal disease hai jo paudhon ko nuksan pahunchati hai. Isse bachne ke liye aapko kuch kadam uthane chahiye:

1. **Fungicides ka istemal**: Phytophthora ke liye specific fungicides ka istemal karein, jaise ki metalaxyl ya fosetyl-aluminium. Inhe label par diye gaye instructions ke anusar istemal karein.

2. **Soil drainage sudharna**: Behtar drainage se paudhon ki jrooton ko paani se bachaya ja sakta hai, kyunki ye fungus zyada paani wale mahol mein tezi se failta hai.

3. **Crop rotation**: Phytophthora se prabhavit crops ke baad alag crops ka chayan karein, taaki fungus ka spread roka ja sake.

4. **Healthy seedlings ka istemal**: Hamesha swasth aur certified seedlings ka istemal karein, taaki disease ka prabhav kam ho.

5. **Regular monitoring**: Apne crops ko niyamit roop se check karein aur kisi bhi prakar ke symptoms ko turant pehchanein.

Agar aapko specific treatment ya fungicide ki zarurat hai, to aap mujhe bata sakte hain, main aapko aur jaankari de sakta hoon.
Treatment btao
messages.standalone_question: What treatment should I use?
messages.standalone_en: What treatment should I use?

messages.content:
Phytophthora ke liye treatment ke liye aapko kuch specific fungicides ka istemal karna chahiye. Yahan kuch prabhavi fungicides aur unka istemal ka tarika diya gaya hai:

1. **Metalaxyl**: 
   - Istemal: 1-2 g per liter paani.
   - Isse paudhon ki jrooton par spray karein ya drench karein.

2. **Fosetyl-Aluminium**: 
   - Istemal: 2-3 g per liter paani.
   - Isse bhi paudhon ki jrooton par spray ya drench karein.

3. **Carbendazim**: 
   - Istemal: 2.5 g per liter paani.
   - Isse seedling par spray karein.

**Additional Measures**:
- Soil drainage ko sudharna.
- Behtar quality ke seedlings ka istemal.
- Regular monitoring aur symptoms ko turant pehchana.

In treatments ko istemal karne se pehle, hamesha label par diye gaye instructions ko dhyan se padhein aur zarurat padne par local agricultural expert se salah lein.
Phosphoric acid kaise use kre
messages.standalone_question: How should phosphoric acid be used?
messages.standalone_en: How should phosphoric acid be used?

messages.content:
Phosphoric acid ka istemal kafi tarikon se kiya ja sakta hai, lekin yeh khaas taur par fertilizers ke roop mein istemal hota hai. Yahan kuch tarike diye gaye hain:

1. **Fertigation**:
   - Phosphoric acid ko irrigation system ke zariye paudhon tak pahunchaya ja sakta hai. 
   - Iska istemal karne se pehle, isse paani mein achhe se milana zaroori hai.

2. **Foliar Spray**:
   - Phosphoric acid ko paani ke sath milakar paudhon ke patton par spray kiya ja sakta hai.
   - Iska concentration 0.5% se 1% hona chahiye. (Yani 5-10 ml phosphoric acid ko 1 liter paani mein milana).

3. **Soil Application**:
   - Phosphoric acid ko seedbed ya soil mein directly daal kar bhi istemal kiya ja sakta hai.
   - Iska istemal karne se pehle soil ki pH aur nutrient levels ko jaanch lena chahiye.

**Important Tips**:
- Hamesha gloves aur mask ka istemal karein jab aap phosphoric acid ka istemal kar rahe ho.
- Iska istemal karne se pehle, local agricultural expert se salah lena behtar hota hai.

Agar aapko specific crop ya condition ke liye guidance chahiye, to aap mujhe bata sakte hain.
Puri details btao phosphoric acid ki
messages.standalone_question: Can you provide complete details about phosphoric acid?
messages.standalone_en: Can you provide complete details about phosphoric acid?

messages.content:
Phosphoric acid (H₃PO₄) ek inorganic acid hai jo agriculture mein khaas taur par fertilizers ke roop mein istemal hota hai. Yahan iski puri details di gayi hain:

### 1. **Chemical Properties**:
   - **Formula**: H₃PO₄
   - **Molecular Weight**: 98 g/mol
   - **Appearance**: Colorless, odorless liquid
   - **pH**: Acidic (pH 1-2 in concentrated form)

### 2. **Uses in Agriculture**:
   - **Fertilizers**: Phosphoric acid ka istemal phosphorus fertilizers (jaise DAP, MAP) banane mein hota hai, jo paudhon ke liye essential nutrient hai.
   - **Soil Amendment**: Yeh soil ki fertility ko badhata hai aur phosphorus ki kami ko door karta hai.
   - **Foliar Spray**: Phosphoric acid ko foliar spray ke roop mein bhi istemal kiya ja sakta hai, jo paudhon ki growth aur development ko sudharne mein madad karta hai.

### 3. **Application Methods**:
   - **Fertigation**: Irrigation system ke zariye paudhon tak pahunchana.
   - **Foliar Application**: Paani ke sath milakar patton par spray karna.
   - **Soil Application**: Seedbed ya soil mein directly daalna.

### 4. **Dosage**:
   - **Fertigation**: 1-2 ml per liter paani.
   - **Foliar Spray**: 0.5% se 1% concentration (5-10 ml per liter paani).
   - **Soil Application**: Soil ki nutrient requirement ke hisaab se.

### 5. **Benefits**:
   - **Root Development**: Phosphorus ki availability se paudhon ki jrooton ka vikas hota hai.
   - **Flowering and Fruiting**: Yeh flowering aur fruiting ko promote karta hai.
   - **Disease Resistance**: Phosphorus ki sahi matra se paudhe behtar disease resistance prapt karte hain.

### 6. **Precautions**:
   - **Safety Gear**: Gloves aur mask ka istemal karein.
   - **Dilution**: Hamesha phosphoric acid ko paani mein achhe se milakar istemal karein.
   - **Storage**: Isse thandi aur sookhi jagah par rakhein, door from sunlight.

### 7. **Environmental Impact**:
   - **Soil pH**: Iska excessive istemal soil ki pH ko badal sakta hai, isliye iski matra ka dhyan rakhna zaroori hai.
   - **Water Contamination**: Yeh water bodies ko contaminate kar sakta hai agar sahi tarike se istemal nahi kiya gaya.

Agar aapko kisi specific crop ya condition ke liye aur jaankari chahiye, to aap mujhe bata sakte hain.
Recommend dose
messages.standalone_question: What is the recommended dosage for using phosphoric acid in agriculture?
messages.standalone_en: What is the recommended dosage for using phosphoric acid in agriculture?

messages.content:
Seed treatment ke liye aapko in insecticides aur fungicides ka istemal karna chahiye:

### Insecticide:
- **Imidacloprid 600 FS**: 
  - **Dose**: 5 to 8 ml per kg seeds.

### Fungicide:
- **Thiram**: 
  - **Dose**: 2 to 3 gm per kg seeds.

### Application Method:
1. **Mixing**: Insecticide aur fungicide ko seeds ke sath achhe se milayein.
2. **Soaking**: Agar zarurat ho to seeds ko kuch samay ke liye solution mein bhigo sakte hain.
3. **Drying**: Treatment ke baad seeds ko sookhne de, phir beejai karein.

Yeh doses aapke seeds ki protection ke liye prabhavi hain. Hamesha label par diye gaye instructions ko dhyan se padhein aur local agricultural expert se salah lein.

messages.standalone_question: What are the best pesticides for Melybug?
messages.standalone_en: What are the best pesticides for Melybug?

messages.content:
For controlling mealybugs, the following pesticides are effective:

1. **Imidacloprid**: A systemic insecticide that targets mealybugs effectively.
2. **Thiamethoxam**: Another systemic option that works well against mealybugs.
3. **Chlorpyrifos**: A broad-spectrum insecticide that can help control mealybug populations.
4. **Neem Oil**: A natural pesticide that disrupts the life cycle of mealybugs.
5. **Insecticidal Soap**: Effective for direct contact and can help control mealybug infestations.

Always follow the manufacturer's instructions for application rates and safety precautions.

messages.content:
The analysis of your grape crop image indicates the following potential issues:

### 1. Iron Deficiency
- **Symptoms**: 
  - Yellowing of leaves starting from the margins.
  - Leaf veins remain green.
  - Eventually, leaves may turn whitish-yellow with brown spots.
  - Stunted growth.

- **Control Measures**:
  - Apply fertilizers containing iron, such as Ferrous sulphate (Fe 19%).
  - Consult with your agricultural advisor for the best product and dosage tailored to your soil and crop.
  - Conduct a soil test before the cropping season to optimize production.

### 2. Powdery Mildew (Very Unlikely)
- **Symptoms**: 
  - Yellow spots on young leaves near the margins.
  - Gray to white powdery fungal growth on these spots.
  - Brown or black patches on veins and shoots.
  - Fruits may turn dark brown and scarred.

- **Control Measures**:
  - Implement an integrated approach combining preventive measures with biological treatments.
  - Ensure good spray coverage on all green plant surfaces and apply treatments timely.
  - Use protectants based on sulfur, oils, bicarbonates, or fatty acids to reduce initial infections.
  - If mildew is detected, consider using products based on strobilurins and azonaphthalenes.

### 3. Downy Mildew (Very Unlikely)
- **Symptoms**: 
  - Yellowish-green oily spots with a brownish halo on leaves.
  - Spots may develop into irregular brown patches.
  - White to grayish cottony growth under the spots.
  - Can affect shoots, tendrils, and inflorescence, leading to stunted growth.

- **Control Measures**:
  - Similar to powdery mildew, use an integrated approach with preventive and biological treatments.
  - Apply protectant fungicides properly to the underside of leaves.
  - Copper-based fungicides, like Bordeaux mixture, can be effective.
  - Use post-infection fungicides immediately after detecting symptoms, such as fosetyl-aluminum and phenylamides.

Make sure to monitor your crops regularly and take action promptly to manage these issues effectively.

messages.content:
It seems that the analysis of your turmeric crop image did not yield clear results due to potential issues with the image quality. However, if you suspect pest infestation, here are some common pests that affect turmeric and their control measures:

### Common Pests in Turmeric:
1. **Leaf Roller**:
   - **Symptoms**: Leaves rolled up, feeding damage.
   - **Control Measures**: 
     - Use insecticides like Chlorpyrifos or Thiamethoxam as per label instructions.
     - Handpick and destroy rolled leaves.

2. **Aphids**:
   - **Symptoms**: Curling leaves, sticky residue (honeydew).
   - **Control Measures**: 
     - Spray with neem oil or insecticidal soap.
     - Introduce natural predators like ladybugs.

3. **Whiteflies**:
   - **Symptoms**: Yellowing leaves, honeydew, and sooty mold.
   - **Control Measures**: 
     - Use yellow sticky traps to monitor and reduce populations.
     - Apply insecticides like Imidacloprid.

4. **Thrips**:
   - **Symptoms**: Silver streaks on leaves, stunted growth.
   - **Control Measures**: 
     - Use insecticidal soap or neem oil.
     - Regularly monitor and remove infested plants.

### General Control Measures:
- **Cultural Practices**: 
  - Rotate crops to break pest cycles.
  - Maintain proper spacing and sanitation to reduce pest habitats.
  
- **Regular Monitoring**: 
  - Inspect plants frequently for early signs of pest activity.

If you can provide a clearer image or more details about the symptoms observed, I can offer more specific advice.

messages.content:
The analysis of your crop image indicates the presence of **Aphids**. 

### Symptoms of Aphids:
- Small, soft-bodied insects that can be green, black, or brown.
- Curling or yellowing of leaves.
- Sticky residue (honeydew) on leaves, which can lead to sooty mold.
- Stunted growth due to sap-sucking.

### Control Measures:
1. **Cultural Control**:
   - Encourage natural predators like ladybugs and lacewings.
   - Remove weeds and debris that can harbor aphids.

2. **Chemical Control**:
   - **Insecticidal Soap**: Spray with insecticidal soap to suffocate aphids.
   - **Neem Oil**: Apply neem oil as a natural pesticide.
   - **Systemic Insecticides**: Use products containing Thiamethoxam or Imidacloprid as per label instructions.

3. **Monitoring**:
   - Regularly check plants for signs of aphids and take action promptly.

Implement these measures to effectively manage the aphid population in your crop.

Since there is no existing spray schedule for your plot today, you can proceed with the following spray application to address the iron deficiency:

### Suggested Spray Application for Iron Deficiency:
1. **Fertilizer**: Use a foliar spray containing Iron Chelate (e.g., Fe-EDTA or Fe-DTPA).
   - **Concentration**: Mix according to the manufacturer's instructions, typically around 0.5% to 1% solution.
   - **Application Rate**: Spray 200-300 liters of solution per acre, ensuring thorough coverage of the leaves.

2. **Timing**: 
   - Apply during the early morning or late afternoon to avoid leaf burn and maximize absorption.

3. **Frequency**: 
   - Repeat the application every 2-3 weeks until symptoms improve.

Make sure to monitor the crop after application for any changes in leaf color and overall health.

messages.standalone_question: What are the signs of nutrient deficiency in crops, and how can I identify them?
messages.standalone_en: What are the signs of nutrient deficiency in crops, and how can I identify them?

faq:
Q: Why should I consider soil, leaf, or petiole testing?
A: Soil, leaf, and petiole testing are crucial for effective plant health management. These tests provide specific data about your crop's nutrient needs, allowing for more precise fertilizer application. This can lead to higher productivity with optimized input use, potentially reducing costs and environmental impact.

messages.content:
The analysis of your crop image did not yield specific results for nutrient deficiency due to potential issues with the image quality. However, here are some common signs of nutrient deficiencies in crops:

### Common Nutrient Deficiencies:
1. **Nitrogen Deficiency**:
   - **Symptoms**: Yellowing of older leaves, stunted growth.
   - **Control**: Apply nitrogen-rich fertilizers like urea or ammonium sulfate.

2. **Phosphorus Deficiency**:
   - **Symptoms**: Dark green or purplish leaves, stunted root growth.
   - **Control**: Use phosphorus fertilizers like superphosphate.

3. **Potassium Deficiency**:
   - **Symptoms**: Yellowing of leaf edges, leaf curling, and poor fruit development.
   - **Control**: Apply potassium fertilizers like muriate of potash.

4. **Iron Deficiency**:
   - **Symptoms**: Yellowing of younger leaves while veins remain green (interveinal chlorosis).
   - **Control**: Use iron chelate foliar sprays.

5. **Magnesium Deficiency**:
   - **Symptoms**: Yellowing between leaf veins, leaf curling.
   - **Control**: Apply magnesium sulfate (Epsom salt).

### Recommendations:
- **Soil Testing**: Conduct a soil test to determine specific nutrient levels and deficiencies.
- **Foliar Testing**: Leaf analysis can also help identify nutrient deficiencies.

If you can provide a clearer image or more details about the symptoms observed, I can offer more specific advice.
What is the use of “Delta T”?
messages.standalone_question: What is the purpose of "Delta T"?
messages.standalone_en: What is the purpose of "Delta T"?

faq:
Q: What is Delta T & VPD?
A: Delta T is the difference between dry bulb and wet bulb temperature values. When this value is between 2-9, the stomatal cells on plant leaves are open, increasing the effectiveness of foliar applications.
   VPD (Vapor Pressure Deficit) represents the right time for fertigation when active absorption by a plant is highest.

messages.content: Delta T is used to determine the difference between dry bulb and wet bulb temperatures. It helps in assessing the stomatal opening on plant leaves, which is crucial for optimizing foliar applications. When Delta T is between 2-9, it indicates that the stomatal cells are open, enhancing the effectiveness of foliar sprays and improving nutrient absorption by the plants.

What is kPa?What does the colour code indicates in the application?
messages.standalone_question: What is kPa, and what does the color code indicate in the application?
messages.standalone_en: What is kPa, and what does the color code indicate in the application?

messages.content:
kPa (kilopascal) is a unit of pressure used to measure soil moisture tension. In the context of soil moisture, it indicates how much suction the soil is exerting to hold onto water. 

### Color Code Indicators in the Application:
- **Green (0-50 kPa)**: Indicates wet soil, which is ideal for crops.
- **Yellow (51-100 kPa)**: Indicates moderate moisture levels; irrigation may be needed soon.
- **Red (101-200 kPa)**: Indicates dry soil; irrigation is necessary to prevent stress on the crops.

These color codes help farmers quickly assess the moisture status of their soil and make informed irrigation decisions.
How to calculate a water tank?
messages.standalone_question: How do you calculate the volume of a water tank?
messages.standalone_en: How do you calculate the volume of a water tank?

messages.content:
To calculate the water tank capacity needed for irrigation, you can follow these steps:

1. **Determine the Area of the Plot**: Measure the area of the plot in acres or square meters.

2. **Calculate the Water Requirement**: 
   - Determine the crop's water requirement per acre (in inches or millimeters). This can vary based on the crop type, growth stage, and climate conditions.
   - Convert the water requirement to volume. For example, 1 inch of water over 1 acre is approximately 27,154 gallons or 113,562 liters.

3. **Calculate the Total Water Needed**:
   - Multiply the water requirement by the area of the plot.
   - For example, if your plot is 4 acres and the crop requires 1 inch of water, the total water needed would be:
     \[
     \text{Total Water (liters)} = \text{Area (acres)} \times \text{Water Requirement (inches)} \times 113,562
     \]

4. **Consider the Irrigation Efficiency**: 
   - If your irrigation system is not 100% efficient, adjust the total water needed accordingly. For example, if the efficiency is 80%, divide the total water needed by 0.8.

5. **Determine the Tank Size**: 
   - Based on the total water needed and the frequency of irrigation, determine the size of the water tank. Ensure that the tank can hold enough water to meet the irrigation needs for the desired period.

### Example Calculation:
- **Area**: 4 acres
- **Water Requirement**: 1 inch
- **Total Water Needed**: 
  \[
  4 \text{ acres} \times 1 \text{ inch} \times 113,562 \text{ liters/inch} = 454,248 \text{ liters}
  \]
- **Adjust for Efficiency**: 
  \[
  \text{Adjusted Total} = \frac{454,248}{0.8} = 567,810 \text{ liters}
  \]

This means you would need a water tank with a capacity of at least 567,810 liters to meet the irrigation needs for that plot.

tools:
get_specific_fertigation_requirements  
Finds the fertigation requirements for the plots with a particular crop stage and week numbers.

get_fertigation_schedule  
Checks the farmer's crop stages and requirements with internal petiole reports and gives the current week fertigation schedule details, and details of the next fertigation schedule (could be next week in the same crop stage or in next crop stage) for the plots. Fertilizers are given by 3 distribution methods:  
- Fertigation: fertilizers put into the irrigation pipeline itself  
- Foliar: on the leaves using a foliar spray  
- Soil: directly on the soil  
If the unit of fertilizer amount includes "per acre", then it is for 1 acre. Otherwise it is for "units per 1 plant".
faq:
Q: How do I generate a fertigation schedule in the app?
A: To generate a fertigation schedule, follow these steps:

    1. Go to "My Farm"
    2. Select "Fertigation"
    3. Tap "Create Report"
    4. Fill in all the required details
    5. Save the report
    If you have soil, leaf, or petiole test data, you can input this for a more customized schedule. Otherwise, we can generate a basic schedule using general crop and regional data.

Q: If I don't add any test data, what is the basis for the generated fertigation schedule?
A: When no specific test data is provided, Fyllo generates a basic fertigation schedule based on:

    1. Typical nutrient needs for your crop type
    2. General soil characteristics common in your region
    3. Standard growing practices for your area
    This schedule provides a starting point, but may not be as precise as one based on specific test data.

Q: Do I need to do fertigation on my farm?
A: Fyllo provides a fixed fertigation schedule based on plot and crop details, along with weather forecasting data for farmer plots, to decide the fertilizer/fertigation needs.

Q: Where can I find the fertigation schedule in the Fyllo app?
A: To access the fertigation schedule:
    1. Open the Fyllo app
    2. Select "My Farm" at the bottom
    3. Tap on the "Fertigation" option
   You'll find the fertigation schedule there, including details about the required fertilizer applications.

Q: Can I generate a fertigation schedule without soil, leaf, or petiole data?
A: Yes, you can generate a basic fertigation schedule without specific soil, leaf, or petiole data. Fyllo will create a general schedule based on typical crop needs and soil types for your region.

When to irrigate?
messages.standalone_question: When is the appropriate time to irrigate crops?
messages.standalone_en: When is the appropriate time to irrigate crops?

tools:
should_i_give_water  
Checks the current and optimal soil moisture values and decides whether the farmer should give water to the plot now or today.

get_optimal_soil_moistures  
Retrieves the optimal soil moisture values in kPa or percentage above which to irrigate for all plots. 0 kPa means wet, 200 kPa means dry soil. In percentage: 0% means dry, 100% means wet. In percentage values, irrigate when below the optimum range.
faq:
Q: How much to irrigate after receiving notification?
A: The net quantity of water to be applied depends on the moisture deficit in the soil, leaching requirement, and expectancy of rainfall. When no rainfall is expected and the soil is not saline, the net quantity equals the moisture deficit in the soil.

Q: Why should I water my crop?
A: Watering your crop is essential to maintain the right moisture balance for healthy growth. Fyllo provides soil monitoring sensors that can provide irrigation precise requirement forecasting. The forecast will also provide the details for why and when you should irrigate.

Q: When should I water? (Hindi: Paani kab dun?)
A: 0-5 kPa is wet, and increasing kPa means increasing dryness. The crop should stay in its optimal moisture zone, and when very close or above the dry optimal moisture, water can be given. Check internal irrigation forecast for the correct answer.

Q: What is the right time to sow the seeds?
A: Check the weather forecast for the next few days (tool call), and then decide the right time for the crop, based on own's knowledge.

Q: When should we take the petiole and soil samples?
A: It varies crop-wise.

Best insecticide for thrips
messages.standalone_question: What is the best insecticide for controlling thrips?
messages.standalone_en: What is the best insecticide for controlling thrips?

faq:
Q: which are the insecticide and fungicide to be used for seed treatment
A: Insecticide:  Imidacloprid 600 FS – 5 to 8 ml/kg seeds
Fungicide: Thiram – 2 to 3 gm/kg seed

messages.content:
The best insecticides for controlling thrips include:

1. **Imidacloprid** - Effective against a wide range of pests, including thrips.
2. **Thiamethoxam** - A systemic insecticide that provides good control of thrips.
3. **Spinosad** - A natural insecticide that is effective against thrips and is safe for beneficial insects.
4. **Chlorantraniliprole** - Another effective option for thrips control.

Always follow the recommended dosage and safety guidelines when applying these insecticides.
They all are safe for honey bee
messages.standalone_question: Are all of these insecticides safe for honey bees?
messages.standalone_en: Are all of these insecticides safe for honey bees?

messages.content:
Among the insecticides mentioned, **Spinosad** is considered safe for honey bees when used according to label instructions. It has a lower toxicity to beneficial insects compared to other chemical insecticides. 

However, **Imidacloprid** and **Thiamethoxam** can be harmful to bees, especially if applied during flowering when bees are active. It's essential to apply these insecticides in the evening or when bees are less active to minimize their impact on honey bees.

Always check the specific product label for safety information regarding bees and other beneficial insects.
Nativo fungicide is harmfull for honeybee ?
messages.standalone_question: Is Nativo fungicide harmful to honey bees?
messages.standalone_en: Is Nativo fungicide harmful to honey bees?

messages.content: Yes, Nativo fungicide, which contains the active ingredients Tebuconazole and Trifloxystrobin, can be harmful to honey bees. It is important to follow the application guidelines and avoid spraying during flowering periods when bees are active to minimize the risk to these beneficial insects. Always check the product label for specific safety information regarding bees and other non-target organisms.

messages.content:
दाळिंब फळांवर लालचट्टा आणि काळा ठिपका येणे हे "Alternaria" किंवा "Anthracnose" सारख्या रोगांचे लक्षण असू शकते. हे रोग फळांच्या गुणवत्तेवर परिणाम करू शकतात.

तुम्हाला या रोगांवर नियंत्रण ठेवण्यासाठी योग्य कीटकनाशकांचा वापर करणे आवश्यक आहे. तुम्ही खालील उपाययोजना करू शकता:

1. **पाण्याची योग्य व्यवस्था**: पाण्याची कमी किंवा अधिकता या रोगांना प्रोत्साहन देऊ शकते.
2. **कीटकनाशकांचा वापर**: योग्य कीटकनाशकांचा वापर करून रोगांचा प्रभाव कमी करा.
3. **पिकांची तपासणी**: नियमितपणे पिकांची तपासणी करा आणि रोगांचे लक्षणे लक्षात ठेवा.

जर तुम्हाला अधिक माहिती हवी असेल किंवा विशिष्ट कीटकनाशकांची शिफारस हवी असेल, तर कृपया सांगा.
messages.en:
Redness and black patches on pomegranate fruits can be a sign of diseases such as "alternaria" or "anthracnose." These diseases can affect the quality of the fruit.

You need to use the right pesticides to control these diseases. You can take the following measures:

1. **Proper water management**: Lack or excess of water can promote these diseases.
2. **Use of pesticides**: Reduce the impact of diseases by using the right pesticides.
3. **Crop inspection**: Check crops regularly and remember the symptoms of diseases.

If you would like more information or a recommendation for specific pesticides, please let us know.

faq:
Q: Do I need to do fertigation on my farm?
A: Fyllo provides a fixed fertigation schedule based on plot and crop details, along with weather forecasting data for farmer plots, to decide the fertilizer/fertigation needs.

Q: What are mixed fertilizers (NPK)?
A: NPK fertilizers are represented by a three-number sequence, such as 10-10-10, indicating the percentage by weight of each nutrient. For example, 10-10-10 means the fertilizer contains 10% Nitrogen, 10% Phosphorus, and 10% Potassium elements in the chemical mixture. Some examples are below:
0-40-37, 0-40-40, 0-49-32, 0-52-34 (Mono potassium phosphate), 0-55-18, 0-60-20, 0-9-46, 10-26-26, 10-54-10, 11-44-11, 12-11-18, 12-32-16, 12-61-0, 13-0-45 (Potassium Nitrate), 13-40-13, 19-19-19, 20-20-0-13 (Ammonium Phosphate Sulphate), 24-24-0, 30-10-10, 6-34-17
Or 0:40:37, 0:40:40, 0:49:32, 0:52:34 (Mono potassium phosphate), 0:55:18, 0:60:20, 0:9:46, 10:26:26, 10:54:10, 11:44:11, 12:11:18, 12:32:16, 12:61:0, 13:0:45 (Potassium Nitrate), 13:40:13, 19:19:19, 20:20:0:13 (Ammonium Phosphate Sulphate), 24:24:0, 30:10:10, 6:34:17
Or 0.40.37, 0.40.40, 0.49.32, 0.52.34 (Mono potassium phosphate), 0.55.18, 0.60.20, 0.9.46, 10.26.26, 10.54.10, 11.44.11, 12.11.18, 12.32.16, 12.61.0, 13.0.45 (Potassium Nitrate), 13.40.13, 19.19.19, 20.20.0.13 (Ammonium Phosphate Sulphate), 24.24.0, 30.10.10, 6.34.17

Q: which are the insecticide and fungicide to be used for seed treatment
A: Insecticide:  Imidacloprid 600 FS – 5 to 8 ml/kg seeds
Fungicide: Thiram – 2 to 3 gm/kg seed

Q: How can I trust that Fyllo's fertigation schedule is accurate?
A: Fyllo's fertigation schedule is scientifically developed and validated based on crop requirements. It takes into account factors such as crop variety, growth stage, soil conditions, and available nutrient data from soil, leaf, or petiole tests when available.

Q: Why should I consider soil, leaf, or petiole testing?
A: Soil, leaf, and petiole testing are crucial for effective plant health management. These tests provide specific data about your crop's nutrient needs, allowing for more precise fertilizer application. This can lead to higher productivity with optimized input use, potentially reducing costs and environmental impact.

messages.content:
गर्भ धरणेसाठी (Fruit Set) तुम्हाला खालील स्प्रे वापरावे लागतील:

1. **Auxins** (जसे की NAA - नॅफ्थालिन एसीटिक आम्ल) - हे फळांच्या सेटिंगसाठी मदत करतात.
2. **Gibberellins** - हे फळांच्या वाढीसाठी आणि आकारासाठी उपयुक्त आहेत.
3. **Potassium Nitrate** - हे फळांच्या गुणवत्तेसाठी आणि उत्पादनासाठी उपयुक्त आहे.

तुम्ही या स्प्रेयांचा वापर करून गर्भ धरणे सुधारू शकता. स्प्रे करताना हवामान आणि पाण्याची स्थिती लक्षात घेणे महत्त्वाचे आहे.
messages.en:
For pregnancy (Fruit Set) you will have to use the following sprays:

1. **Auxins** (such as NAA - Naphthalene Acetic Acid) - These help with the setting of fruits.
2. Gibberellins – These are useful for fruit growth and size.
3. Potassium Nitrate - It is useful for fruit quality and production.

You can improve pregnancy by using these sprays. It is important to take into account the weather and water conditions when spraying.

messages.content: Mera began ar tmatr ke phodha me wilt aa raha hai kon sa dava dalna hai
messages.en: I am getting wilt in my beginning, which medicine should I put
messages.standalone_question: What medicine should I add to the plant that is starting to wilt?
messages.standalone_en: What medicine should I add to the plant that is starting to wilt?

messages.content:
Agar aapke brinjal ke podhe mein wilt aa raha hai, to aapko fungicide ka istemal karna chahiye. Aap "Fusarium wilt" ke liye "Carbendazim" ya "Thiophanate-methyl" ka istemal kar sakte hain. 

**Dava ka istemal:**
- **Carbendazim**: 1-2 g/liter paani mein milakar daalna.
- **Thiophanate-methyl**: 1-2 g/liter paani mein milakar daalna.

Iske alawa, podhe ki jameen ki sehat aur paani ki matra ka dhyan rakhna bhi zaroori hai.
messages.en:
If you have wilt in your brindle plant, you should use fungicides. You can use "Karabendjim" or "Thiophanate-Methyl" for "Fusarium Wilt". 

**Medication Use:**
- **Karbendazim**: Mix in 1-2 g/liter of water.
- Thiophanate-methyl: Mix with 1-2 g/litre of water.

In addition, it is important to take care of the health of the plant soil and the amount of water it contains.

messages.content: Ar tamatr ke phodha me
messages.en: In the fodha of Aar Tatra
messages.standalone_question: What should I do if my tomato plant is experiencing issues?
messages.standalone_en: What should I do if my tomato plant is experiencing issues?

messages.content:
Tamatar ke podhe mein wilt hone par aapko kuch specific dawaon ka istemal karna chahiye. Yahan kuch dawaen hain jo aap istemal kar sakte hain:

1. **Fusarium wilt ke liye**:
   - **Carbendazim**: 1-2 g/liter paani mein milakar daalna.
   - **Thiophanate-methyl**: 1-2 g/liter paani mein milakar daalna.

2. **Damping off ke liye**:
   - **Carbendazim**: 2.5 g/liter paani mein milakar daalna.

3. **Pest control**:
   - **Chlorpyriphos**: 5 mL/liter paani mein milakar daalna.
   - **Thiamethoxam**: 0.5 g/liter paani mein milakar daalna.

In dawaon ka istemal karne se aap apne tamatar ke podhon ko wilt se bachane mein madad kar sakte hain.
messages.en:
You should use some specific medicines when the tomato plant wilts. Here are some medications you can use:

1. **For Fusarium Wilt**:
   - **Karbendazim**: Mix in 1-2 g/liter of water.
   - Thiophanate-methyl: Mix with 1-2 g/litre of water.

2. **For Dumping Off**:
   - **Karabendazim**: Mix in 2.5 g/liter of water.

3. **Paste Control**:
   - Chlorpyrifos: Mix with 5 mL/L of water.
   - **Thiamethok**: Mix with 0.5 g/liter of water.

Using these medications can help you protect your tomato plants from wilt.

messages.content: द्राक्ष मनी साइजसाठी काय करावे
messages.en: What to do for grape money size
messages.standalone_question: What should I do to determine the size for grapes?
messages.standalone_en: What should I do to determine the size for grapes?

messages.content:
द्राक्षांच्या बियाण्यांच्या साईजसाठी, तुम्हाला खालील गोष्टींचा विचार करावा लागेल:

1. **बियाण्यांची साईज**: द्राक्षांच्या बियाण्यांना साधारणतः 1-2 सेंटीमीटरच्या गहराईत पेरावे. 
   - बियाण्यांच्या साईजच्या दुप्पट गहराईत पेरणे योग्य असते.

2. **बीज उपचार**: 
   - **कीटकनाशक**: इमिडाक्लोप्रिड 600 FS – 5 ते 8 मिली/किलो बियाणे.
   - **फंगीसाइड**: थिराम – 2 ते 3 ग्रॅम/किलो बियाणे.

3. **गर्मेशन तपासणी**: 
   - 100 (लहान बियाणे) किंवा 50 (मोठे बियाणे) बियाणे निवडा आणि गीले कागदावर ठेवा.
   - 3-5 दिवसांनी किती बियाणे उगवले ते मोजा आणि उगवण्याचा टक्का काढा.

4. **गर्मेशन सुधारण्यासाठी**: 
   - चांगल्या गुणवत्तेची बियाणे वापरा आणि बियाणे कीटकनाशक, फंगीसाइड आणि जैविक एजंटसह उपचारित करा.

तुमच्या द्राक्षांच्या पिकासाठी हे सर्व महत्त्वाचे आहे.
messages.en:
For the size of grape seeds, you may need to consider the following:

1. **Seed size**: The grape seeds should be sown in a depth of about 1-2 centimeters. 
   - It is advisable to sow at twice the size of the seeds.

2. **Seed Treatment**: 
   * Pesticide**: Imidacloprid 600 FS – 5 to 8 ml/kg seeds.
   * Fungiside**: Thiram – 2 to 3 g/kg of seeds.

3. **Heatation check**: 
   Choose 100 (small seeds) or 50 (large seeds) seeds and place on wet paper.
   Measure how many seeds germinated after 3-5 days and remove the germination percentage.

4. **To improve germination**: 
   Use good quality seeds and treat the seeds with pesticides, fungicides, and biological agents.

All of this is important for your grape crop.

messages.content:
**કટવોર્મ (Cut Worm) માટેની આગાહી:**

- **31 જાન્યુઆરી 2025:** 68.2% - મધ્યમ જોખમ
- **30 જાન્યુઆરી 2025:** 69.0% - મધ્યમ જોખમ
- **29 જાન્યુઆરી 2025:** 67.2% - મધ્યમ જોખમ
- **28 જાન્યુઆરી 2025:** 63.9% - મધ્યમ જોખમ
- **27 જાન્યુઆરી 2025:** 63.9% - મધ્યમ જોખમ
- **26 જાન્યુઆરી 2025:** 60.4% - મધ્યમ જોખમ
- **25 જાન્યુઆરી 2025:** 60.4% - મધ્યમ જોખમ
- **24 જાન્યુઆરી 2025:** 67.8% - મધ્યમ જોખમ
- **23 જાન્યુઆરી 2025:** 76.3% - ઊંચું જોખમ
- **22 જાન્યુઆરી 2025:** 74.1% - મધ્યમ જોખમ

કટવોર્મનું જોખમ છેલ્લા કેટલાક દિવસોમાં મધ્યમથી ઊંચું રહ્યું છે. જો કે, 23 અને 19 જાન્યુઆરીએ ઊંચા જોખમના સ્તરો નોંધાયા હતા.

**લાલ કથારી (Red Spider Mites) માટેની માહિતી ઉપલબ્ધ નથી.**

જો તમને વધુ માહિતી અથવા નિયંત્રણના પગલાં જોઈએ, તો મને જણાવો!
messages.en:
**Prediction for Cut Worm:**

* **31 January 2025:** 68.2% - Moderate Risk
* **30 January 2025:** 69.0% - Moderate Risk
* **29 January 2025:** 67.2% - Moderate Risk
* **28 January 2025:** 63.9% - Moderate Risk
* **27 January 2025:** 63.9% - Medium Risk
* **26 January 2025:** 60.4% - Medium Risk
* **25 January 2025:** 60.4% - Moderate Risk
* **24 January 2025:** 67.8% - Medium Risk
* **23 January 2025:** 76.3% - High risk
* **22 January 2025:** 74.1% - Moderate Risk

The risk of cutworms has been moderate to high in the last few days. However, high risk levels were recorded on January 23 and 19.

**Information for Red Spider Mites is not available.**

If you need more information or control measures, let me know!

messages.content:
હા, કાલ્યાણભાઈ, આજે (31 જાન્યુઆરી 2025) તમારે દવા છંટકાવવાની જરૂર છે. 

**દવા છંટકાવ માટેની સૂચનાઓ:**

1. **માઈટ્સ માટે:**
   - **Chlorfenapyr 10 SC:** 1 મીલીલિટર
   - **Propargite 42% + Hexythiazox 2% EC:** 2.5 મીલીલિટર
   - **Cyenopyrafen 30 SC:** 0.6 મીલીલિટર

2. **કટવોર્મ માટે:**
   - **Flubendiamide 480 SC:** 0.5 મીલીલિટર
   - **Cyantraniliprole 7.3% w/w + Diafenthiuron 36.4% w/w SC:** 1.25 મીલીલિટર
   - **Flubendiamide 19.92 + Thiacloprid 19.92 ww SC, 480 SC:** 0.5 મીલીલિટર

**અરજીનો રીત:** ફોલિયર સ્પ્રે (પાન પર છંટકાવ).

જો તમને વધુ મદદની જરૂર હોય, તો મને જણાવો!
messages.en:
Yes, Kalyanbhai, today (January 31, 2025) you need to spray medicines. 

**Instructions for spraying medicines:**

1. For **Mites:**
   - **Chlorfenapyr 10 SC:** 1 millilitre
   - **Propargite 42% + Hexythiazox 2% EC:** 2.5 milliliters
   - **Cyenopyrafen 30 SC:** 0.6 milliliters

2. **For cutworm:**
   - **Flubendiamide 480 SC:** 0.5 milliliters
   - **Cyantraniliprole 7.3% w/w + Diafenthiuron 36.4% w/w SC:** 1.25 millilitre
   - **Flubendiamide 19.92 + Thiacloprid 19.92 ww SC, 480 SC:** 0.5 milliliters

**Method of application:** Foliar spray (sprinkler on leaves).

If you need more help, let me know!

messages.standalone_en: Why is there a need for treatment when the crop is currently healthy?

faq:
Q: Do I need to spray?
A: Check the disease pest spray schedule for the farmer and reply accordingly. Don't check metrics, only pre-defined schedules to be checked.

Q: Why should I water my crop?
A: Watering your crop is essential to maintain the right moisture balance for healthy growth. Fyllo provides soil monitoring sensors that can provide irrigation precise requirement forecasting. The forecast will also provide the details for why and when you should irrigate.

Q: why to use insecticide and fungicide for seed treatment?
A:
- Prevents the spread of plant diseases/pest
- Protects the seed from seed rot and seedling blights
- Improves the seed germination
- Provides protection from storage insects
- Controls the soil insects

આ તબક્કામાં, પાકની પોષણ જરૂરિયાતો અને દવા છંટકાવની જરૂરિયાતો વધે છે. જો તમને વધુ માહિતી અથવા દવા છંટકાવની જરૂર હોય, તો મને જણાવો!

messages.content:
જો તમારા પાકના પાન સૂકા દેખાય છે, પરંતુ સેન્સર ભેજ દર્શાવે છે, તો આ સંકેત હોઈ શકે છે કે જમીનના ઉપરના સ્તરે ભેજ નથી, પરંતુ મૂળ વિસ્તારમાં ભેજ છે. 

કૃપા કરીને ખાતરી કરો કે સેન્સર આસપાસના મૂળ વિસ્તારમાં ભેજ છે કે નહીં. જો તે ભેજ દર્શાવે છે, તો irrigation કરવાની જરૂર નથી. 

જો તમને લાગે છે કે પાણી યોગ્ય રીતે પહોંચતું નથી, તો કૃપા કરીને ચકાસો કે:

1. **ડ્રિપ સિસ્ટમ:** શું ડ્રિપ બ્લોક થયેલ છે?
2. **સેન્સરનું સ્થાન:** શું સેન્સર જમીનના ઢળાવ અથવા અન્ય સમસ્યાઓને કારણે યોગ્ય રીતે કાર્ય કરી રહ્યું છે?

જો તમને વધુ મદદની જરૂર હોય, તો મને જણાવો!
messages.en:
If the leaves of your crop appear dry, but the sensor shows moisture, this may be a sign that there is no moisture at the top level of the ground, but moisture in the original area. 

Please ensure that the sensor is humid in the surrounding original area or not. If it shows moisture, there is no need to do irrigation. 

If you feel that the water is not reaching properly, please check that:

1. **Drip System:** Is the drip blocked?
2. Location of the **Sensor:** Is the sensor functioning properly due to ground slopes or other problems?

If you need more help, let me know!

messages.content:
પ્લોટ "પાઠશાળા"માં **કેટરપિલર** અને **માઈટ્સ** જેવા પેસ્ટ્સનું જોખમ છે, જેનું પ્રમાણ ઊંચું છે. આ ઉપરાંત, **લેટ બ્લાઇટ** અને **અર્લી બ્લાઇટ** જેવા રોગો પણ મધ્યમ જોખમમાં છે.

### રોગો અને પેસ્ટ્સ:
1. **કેટરપિલર**: 92.3% (ઉંચું જોખમ)
2. **માઈટ્સ**: 64.6% (મધ્યમ જોખમ)
3. **લેટ બ્લાઇટ**: 60.7% (મધ્યમ જોખમ)
4. **અર્લી બ્લાઇટ**: 56.4% (મધ્યમ જોખમ)

### સલાહ:
- તાત્કાલિક પગલાં લેવા માટે પેસ્ટ નિયંત્રણ અને રોગ વ્યવસ્થાપન માટે યોગ્ય ઉપાયો અપનાવો.
- રોગો અને પેસ્ટ્સને નિયંત્રિત કરવા માટે ફંગિસાઇડ અને ઇનસેક્ટિસાઇડનો ઉપયોગ કરો.

જો તમને વધુ માહિતી અથવા મદદની જરૂર હોય, તો કૃપા કરીને જણાવો!
messages.en:
The plot "pathshala" has a risk of pastes such as **caterpillars** and **mites**, which have a high proportion. In addition, diseases such as **late blight** and **early blight** are also at moderate risk.

### Diseases and Pastes:
1. **Caterpillar**: 92.3% (high risk)
2. **Mites**: 64.6% (moderate risk)
3. **Late Blight**: 60.7% (moderate risk)
4. **Early Blight**: 56.4% (moderate risk)

### Advice:
- Adopt appropriate measures for pest control and disease management to take immediate action.
Use fungiside and insecticide to control diseases and pests.

If you need more information or help, please let us know!

messages.content:
હાલમાં "પાઠશાળા" પ્લોટ માટે કોઈ છાંટણી શેડ્યૂલ ઉપલબ્ધ નથી. 

પરંતુ, **લેટ બ્લાઇટ** અને **અર્લી બ્લાઇટ** માટે, તમે નીચેની દવાઓનો ઉપયોગ કરી શકો છો:

### ફંગિસાઇડ:
- **Carbendazim**: 1-2 gm/liter પાણીમાં ભેળવો અને છાંટો.

### પેસ્ટ નિયંત્રણ માટે:
- **Imidacloprid**: 5-8 ml/kg બીજ માટે.

જો તમને વધુ માહિતી અથવા મદદની જરૂર હોય, તો કૃપા કરીને જણાવો!
messages.en:
Currently there is no pruning schedule available for the "Pathshala" plot. 

But, for **late blight** and **early blight**, you can use the following medications:

### Fungiside:
* **Carbendazim**: Mix and sprinkle in 1-2 gm/liter water.

### For paste control:
**Imidacloprid**: 5-8 ml/kg for seeds.

If you need more information or help, please let us know!

messages.content: ક્યા પગલા લેવા અને પરફેકટ દવા કહો

messages.standalone_question: What steps should be taken and what is the perfect medicine to use?
messages.standalone_en: What steps should be taken and what is the perfect medicine to use?
messages.content_transliterated: kya pagla leva ane perfect dava kaho

messages.content:
### પગલાં લેવા માટે સૂચનો:

#### 1. **રોગો માટે:**
   - **લેટ બ્લાઇટ** અને **અર્લી બ્લાઇટ** માટે, આ રોગોનું જોખમ ઊંચું છે. 
   - **સૂચન**: રોગ નિયંત્રણ માટે યોગ્ય ફંગિસાઇડનો ઉપયોગ કરો. 
     - **ફંગિસાઇડ**: Carbendazim @ 2.5g/ltr (દ્રેંચ અથવા સ્પ્રે).

#### 2. **ફર્ટિગેશન શેડ્યૂલ:**
   - **વર્તમાન તબક્કો**: વેજેટેટિવ ગ્રોથ (ચોથો અઠવાડિયું)
   - **ફર્ટિગેશન માટેની દવા**:
     - **ફોલિયર મોટેર**:
       - **ઝિંક સલ્ફેટ**: 800 gm/acre
       - **ફેરસ સલ્ફેટ**: 600 gm/acre
       - **મૅંગેનીઝ સલ્ફેટ**: 400 gm/acre
     - **ફર્ટિગેશન**:
       - **કેલ્શિયમ નાઇટ્રેટ**: 3.5 kg/acre
       - **યુરિયા**: 8 kg/acre

#### 3. **આગામી તબક્કો**:
   - **તબક્કો**: ટ્યુબર ડેવલપમેન્ટ
   - **આગામી ફર્ટિગેશન**: 5મું અઠવાડિયું શરૂ થશે 13 ફેબ્રુઆરી 2025.

આ સૂચનોને ધ્યાનમાં રાખીને, યોગ્ય પગલાં લો અને તમારા પાકને સુરક્ષિત રાખો. જો વધુ માહિતી જોઈએ, તો જણાવશો!
messages.en:
### Suggestions for taking action:

#### 1. **For diseases:**
   For **late blight** and **early blight**, the risk of these diseases is high. 
   * **Suggestion**: Use the appropriate fungiside for disease control. 
     * **Fungicide**: Carbendazim @ 2.5g/ltr (trench or spray).

#### 2. **Fertigation Schedule:**
   * **Current phase**: Vegetative growth (4th week)
   - **Medication for Fertigation**:
     - **Folier Moter**:
       **Zinc sulfate**: 800 gm/acre
       - **Ferrous sulfate**: 600 gm/acre
       - **Manganese sulfate**: 400 gm/acre
     - **Fertigation**:
       **Calcium nitrate**: 3.5 kg/acre
       **Urea**: 8 kg/acre

#### 3. **Next stage**:
   - **Stage**: Tuber Development
   * **Next Fertigation**: The 5th week will begin on February 13, 2025.

Keeping these suggestions in mind, take appropriate steps and keep your crop safe. If you need more information, let me know!

Q: Can fungicide and insecticide be sprayed together?
A: For fungicides and insecticides to be sprayed together, it is important to consider factors like compatibility. For expert guidance tailored to your situation, we recommend reaching out to Fyllo’s CRM number for personalized advice.

messages.content:
ફંગિસાઇડ માટેની શ્રેષ્ઠ પસંદગીઓમાં સામેલ છે:

1. **Carbendazim**: 2.5 ગ્રામ/લિટર (દ્રેંચ અથવા સ્પ્રે)
2. **Mancozeb**: 2.5-3 ગ્રામ/લિટર (દ્રેંચ અથવા સ્પ્રે)
3. **Copper Oxychloride**: 3-4 ગ્રામ/લિટર (દ્રેંચ અથવા સ્પ્રે)

આ ફંગિસાઇડ્સ લેટ બ્લાઇટ અને અર્લી બ્લાઇટ જેવા રોગોને નિયંત્રિત કરવામાં મદદરૂપ છે. ઉપયોગ કરતા પહેલા, નિર્દેશોનું પાલન કરવું મહત્વપૂર્ણ છે. જો વધુ માહિતી જોઈએ, તો જણાવશો!
messages.en:
The best picks for fungiside include:

1. **Carbendazim**: 2.5 g/litre (trench or spray)
2. **Mancozeb**: 2.5-3 g/litre (trench or spray)
3. **Copper Oxychloride**: 3-4 g/litre (trench or spray)

These fungisides are helpful in controlling diseases like late blight and early blight. It is important to follow the instructions before using them. If you need more information, let me know!

messages.content:
માફ કરશો, પરંતુ હું સીધા તમારા ફોનમાં મેસેજ મોકલી શકતો નથી. પરંતુ તમે નીચે આપેલા મેસેજને કોપી કરીને તમારા ફોનમાં મોકલી શકો છો:

---

**મેસેજ:**
"મારું ડિવાઇસ કામ નથી કરી રહ્યું. કૃપા કરીને ચકાસો કે રિચાર્જ કરવામાં આવ્યું છે કે નહીં અને ડિવાઇસ સક્રિય રીતે ડેટા મોકલી રહ્યું છે. જો સમસ્યા ચાલુ રહે, તો Fyllo એપ્લિકેશન પર સપોર્ટ ટિકિટ ઉઠાવવાની વિનંતી કરું છું."

---

આ મેસેજને કોપી કરીને તમારા ફોનમાં મોકલવા માટે ઉપયોગ કરો. જો વધુ મદદની જરૂર હોય, તો જણાવશો!

faq:
Q: How do I start the Kairo device?
A: Press the switch below the top cap to start the device and wait until the parameters on the home screen are visible.

messages.content:
જો તમારું "કૈરો" ડિવાઇસ કામ નથી કરી રહ્યું, તો નીચેના પગલાં અજમાવો:

1. **ડિવાઇસને ચકાસો**: ખાતરી કરો કે ડિવાઇસ યોગ્ય રીતે જોડાયેલું છે.
2. **નેટવર્ક કનેક્શન**: ઇન્ટરનેટ કનેક્શન ચકાસો.
3. **બેટરીની સ્થિતિ**: બેટરી ચાર્જ છે કે નહીં તે તપાસો.
4. **ડિવાઇસને પુનઃપ્રારંભ કરો**: ડિવાઇસને બંધ કરીને ફરીથી ચાલુ કરો.

જો સમસ્યા ચાલુ રહે, તો Fyllo એપ્લિકેશનમાં સપોર્ટ ટિકિટ ઉઠાવો અથવા Fyllo ગ્રાહક સપોર્ટ સાથે સંપર્ક કરો.
messages.en:
If your "Cairo" device isn't working, try the following steps:

1. **Check device**: Make sure the device is connected properly.
2. **Network connection**: Check internet connection.
3. **The state of the battery**: Check whether the battery is charged or not.
4. **Restart device**: Turn off the device and restart.

If the problem persists, pick up the support ticket in the Fyllo app or contact Fyllo customer support.

tools:
get_fertigation_schedule  
Checks the farmer's crop stages and requirements with internal petiole reports and gives the current week fertigation schedule details, and details of the next fertigation schedule (could be next week in the same crop stage or in next crop stage) for the plots. Fertilizers are given by 3 distribution methods:  
- Fertigation: fertilizers put into the irrigation pipeline itself  
- Foliar: on the leaves using a foliar spray  
- Soil: directly on the soil  
If the unit of fertilizer amount includes "per acre", then it is for 1 acre. Otherwise it is for "units per 1 plant".

get_specific_fertigation_requirements  
Finds the fertigation requirements for the plots with a particular crop stage and week numbers.
faq:
Q: Do I need to do fertigation on my farm?
A: Fyllo provides a fixed fertigation schedule based on plot and crop details, along with weather forecasting data for farmer plots, to decide the fertilizer/fertigation needs.

Q: If I don't add any test data, what is the basis for the generated fertigation schedule?
A: When no specific test data is provided, Fyllo generates a basic fertigation schedule based on:

    1. Typical nutrient needs for your crop type
    2. General soil characteristics common in your region
    3. Standard growing practices for your area
    This schedule provides a starting point, but may not be as precise as one based on specific test data.

messages.content_transliterated: abhi current schedule week third mein total 4 kile mein kitne fertilizer girega

messages.content:
आपके 4 एकड़ के kinnow प्लॉट के लिए, वर्तमान फर्टिलाइजर शेड्यूल (तीसरे सप्ताह) में निम्नलिखित फर्टिलाइज़र की मात्रा है:

1. **Potassium Nitrate**: 5 किलोग्राम
2. **Urea**: 8.5 किलोग्राम

या

1. **Urea**: 9.5 किलोग्राम
2. **Sulfate of Potash**: 4.5 किलोग्राम

आप इन दोनों संयोजनों में से किसी एक का चयन कर सकते हैं। 

कुल मिलाकर, यदि आप पहले संयोजन का उपयोग करते हैं, तो आपको 5 किलोग्राम + 8.5 किलोग्राम = 13.5 किलोग्राम फर्टिलाइज़र की आवश्यकता होगी। 

यदि आप दूसरे संयोजन का उपयोग करते हैं, तो आपको 9.5 किलोग्राम + 4.5 किलोग्राम = 14 किलोग्राम फर्टिलाइज़र की आवश्यकता होगी। 

आपकी फसल के लिए यह फर्टिलाइज़र की मात्रा प्रति हेक्टेयर है, इसलिए इसे 4 एकड़ के लिए समायोजित करें।
messages.en:
For your 4-acre kinnow plot, the current fertilizer schedule (3rd week) contains the following fertilizer quantities:

1. Potassium Nitrate: 5 kilograms
2. **Urea**: 8.5 Kg

or

1. Urea: 9.5 Kilograms
2. Sulfate of Potash: 4.5 kg

You can choose either of these two combinations. 

In total, if you use the first combination, you will need 5 kg + 8.5 kg = 13.5 kg of fertilizer. 

If you use the second combination, you will need 9.5 kg + 4.5 kg = 14 kg of fertilizer. 

This is the amount of fertilizer per hectare for your crop, so adjust it for 4 acres.
